Html:
Hi, I added Graph# support to the Owasp O2 Platform project a while back, and here are a couple examples of it in action:

  • O2 Platform v4.0 Installer and quick tour of its scripting tools (video) - see the O2's Graph# REPL environment in action from minute 3:40
  • Visualizing TeamMentor Link's structure (with Graphs) 
  • What ‘Graph’ support exists in O2 today - see first set of images
  • GraphSharp_ExtensionMethods.cs extension methods that make it easy to add Nodes and Edges in O2's REPL scripting environment (here is a video showing this O2 REPL scripting environment in action)

I would like to update O2 to the latest version of Graph#, and I can see that you are using Git as the repository.

Since I use GitHub to manage O2's code, could I create a Fork there (in GitHub), make my changes (namely the extension methods) and then send you the Pull Requests?

Sure, i'm waiting for the pull request.

Thanks in advance.
Superb tool. Can you tell me how I can add it in my wpf project?
